intro: Witheringia zuccagniana, commonly known as the Malabar nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of southern India. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a slightly hairy texture. Witheringia zuccagniana is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
